byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham reported from Bangkok, and Thomas Fuller from Yangon, Myanmar.
byline.original: By POYPITI AMATATHAM and THOMAS FULLER

abstract: Thai authorities acknowledge suspect in deadly attack at Bangkok's Erawan Shrine may have fled country, in effort some say is designed to lower expectations about solving crime; lack of evidence and resources, along with false leads, are all considered to have contributed to inability to nab perpetrator.
lead_paragraph: Thailand’s chief of police appeared to be trying to lower public expectations that the main person being sought in the explosion at a shrine would be caught anytime soon.

headline.main: People Sought in Bangkok Bombing May Have Fled Country, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Thai Police Say Bombing Culprit May Have Fled Country

snippet: Thailand’s chief of police appeared to be trying to lower public expectations that the main person being sought in the explosion at a shrine would be caught anytime soon.
